meanings.definition: A permit from an authority to own or use something, do a particular thing, or carry on a trade.
meanings.sent1: She needed a license to drive a car.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant displayed its health inspection license.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his license to eat ice cream was about to expire.
meanings.sent4: Her license to dream was renewed with each sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The license to fish made him feel like a true angler.

meanings.definition: Freedom to behave as one wishes, especially in a way that results in excessive or unacceptable behavior.
meanings.sent1: Having too much freedom can sometimes lead to trouble, like a license to misbehave.
meanings.sent2: The lack of rules gave them a license to cause chaos.
meanings.sent3: His license to be silly knew no bounds.
meanings.sent4: The license to be lazy can sometimes be tempting but has consequences.
meanings.sent5: She felt the weight of her license to ignore responsibilities.

meanings.definition: To give permission to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will license the students to leave early for the field trip.
meanings.sent2: He decided to license his friend to borrow his bike.
meanings.sent3: She would license him to tell jokes at the party.
meanings.sent4: The boss will license the team to take a longer lunch break.
meanings.sent5: The parents will license their children to stay up late for the sleepover.
